p: Because of its significant source of carotenoids, triterpenoids and ascorbic acid, Cissus quadrangularis is used for the gastrointestinal diseases in traditional medicine, and has gained significant recognition on human nutrition. Numerous studies demonstrated the impact of Cissus quadrangularis extract (CQE) on gastrointestinal toxicity and gastro-protective effect. This is together with its function underpinning the clinical intervention toward aspirin-induced gastric mucosal damage [ 13].
